Types

BufferError = object of CatchableError
FontError = object of CatchableError
PixelFormat = enum
  FMT_BGRA, FMT_RGBA, FMT_ARGB, FMT_ABGR
the different pixel formats supported 
BlendMode = enum
  BLEND_ALPHA, BLEND_COLOR, BLEND_ADD, BLEND_SUBTRACT, BLEND_MULTIPLY, BLEND_LIGHTEN,
  BLEND_DARKEN, BLEND_SCREEN, BLEND_DIFFERENCE
the different blend modes supported 
Pixel {...}{.union.} = object
  word*: uint32
  when defined(MODE_RGBA):
      rgba*: tuple[r, g, b, a: uint8]

  elif defined(MODE_ARGB):
      rgba*: tuple[a, r, g, b: uint8]

  elif defined(MODE_ABGR):
      rgba*: tuple[a, b, g, r: uint8]

  else:
      rgba*: tuple[b, g, r, a: uint8]
how color is represented dependeding on which mode is defined at compile time, a different color format is used 
Rect {...}{.packed.} = tuple[x, y, w, h: int]
a rectangle used for clipping and drawing specific regions of buffer 
DrawMode {...}{.packed.} = object
  color*: Pixel
  alpha*: uint8
  blend*: BlendMode
affects how things are drawn onto the buffer 
Transform {...}{.packed.} = tuple[ox, oy, r, sx, sy: float32]
describes a tranformation applied to a buffer when it is drawn onto another buffer 
Buffer = ref object
  mode*: DrawMode
  clip*: Rect
  pixels*: seq[Pixel]
  w*, h*: int
a collection of pixels that represents an image 
Font = ref ptr ttf_Font
a reference to the actual font object

    raises: [KeyError, Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}

    tags: [].}

    raises: [Exception, BufferError], tags: [RootEffect].}

    raises: [Exception, BufferError], tags: [RootEffect].}
